intro: Phytolacca hunanensis, commonly known as the Hunan beggar's-tick, is a herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red, fleshy berries. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
